title: Easy Chicken Curry Recipe
description: This easy chicken curry recipe requires just 4 ingredients: chicken olive oil, onions, and curry powder. It's a one-skillet meal that packs quite a punch.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Indian Easy Chicken Curry 3.9 (119) 106 Reviews 4 Photos Try this easy chicken curry recipe for one of the simplest curry dishes you'll ever make! Just sauté chicken breasts with onion and curry powder, then serve over hot cooked rice with a side of mango chutney if desired. Submitted by Aurelie Stalnaker Updated on April 29, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 4 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 6 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 6 servings ¼ cup olive oil 2 large onions, diced ⅓ cup curry powder, or to taste 6 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into strips Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and sauté until soft and golden brown, 5 to 8 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Slowly stir in curry powder until well blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add chicken; reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 20 to 40 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Uncover and cook, stirring constantly to prevent burning, until pan juices reduce to desired amount, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 164 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Chicken Curry 01 of 04 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 04 Photo by  Shantae Love 05/26/2019 Recipe amazing but instead of two big onions I did one big onion bell pepper and season my chicken breast with a little bit of garlic powder and onion powder And added one can of green beans( drained)and a cup of water perfection 03 of 04 Photo by  Donna Anne 03/21/2018 Easy to make and very tasty. 04 of 04 Photo by  Trudy Victoria Flanagan 11/30/2015 1 You’ll Also Love Indian Tomato Chicken 323 Ratings Masala-Spiced Roast Chicken 39 Ratings Indian Chicken Curry I 219 Ratings Chicken Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Spicy Chicken Curry 43 Ratings Reshmi Kebab (Silken Kebabs) 20 Ratings Indian Chicken Tikka Masala 31 Ratings Slow Cooker Chicken Curry 8 Ratings Traditional Chicken Curry 34 Ratings Goan Pork Vindaloo 22 Ratings Chicken Curry V 16 Ratings Easy Chicken Madras Recipe 6 Ratings Indian-Style "Chettinad" Chicken 1 Rating Biryani with Yogurt Marinated Chicken 18 Ratings Paprika Chicken 28 Ratings Easy Chicken Phaal 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Aurelie Stalnaker
instructions: Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and sauté until soft and golden brown, 5 to 8 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Slowly stir in curry powder until well blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add chicken; reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 20 to 40 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Uncover and cook, stirring constantly to prevent burning, until pan juices reduce to desired amount, 3 to 5 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
